Executive Summary

Owens Corning Insulating Systems, LLC ? Gresham, OR



Introduction



Owens Corning Insulating Systems, LLC (OCIS) owns and operates a polystyrene foam board manufacturing facility in Portland, Oregon (Gresham Facility).  The Gresham Facility consists of polystyrene foam board extrusion with associated equipment; finishing, grinding, and polystyrene reclaim equipment.  One of the blowing agents used at the facility contains an RMP-listed chemical that will be on-site above the threshold storage quantity. As such, the Gresham Facility is subject to RMP regulations in 40 CFR 68 and is submitting this Risk Management Plan as required. 



Plant Description



The Gresham Facility is located at 18456 N.E. Wilkes Road, Portland OR 97080.  



Blowing Agent System/Manufacturing Process Description



Three blowing agent storage tanks are located outside, one containing the RMP-listed chemical. The blowing agent tanks will be filled from tanker trucks or Isotopes at a dedicated outdoor unloading station.  The blowing agents are piped from the outside storage tank, inside to the blowing agent stand and then to the polystyrene foam board extruding system.  The manufacturing process includes extruding molten polystyrene plastic which has been injected with the blowing agent and other additives.  The extruded material expands as the blowing agent vaporizes under a partial vacuum in a vacuum chamber and  produces a basic board stock with a closed cell structure.  The board stock is then cooled to a level suitable for further fabrication, packaging and storage.



Process Hazard Assessment (PHA)



Process hazard assessments were performed on the covered process using a 'HAZOP' type analysis.  The HAZOP analysis results in a listing of undesirable events with their consequences, safeguards, and recommendations for risk reduction



Prevention System



The Gresham Facility has in place a Process Safety Management system.  Procedures are in place for operation

, maintenance and inspection of the covered, blowing agent system. There are Operation and Maintenance documents for each major piece of equipment, and a formal training process for employees and any contractors before being allowed to work on the systems.



The blowing agent system is visually inspected on a periodic basis.  Standard operating procedures (SOPs) for unloading, startup, shutdown, normal operation and emergency operation of the blowing agent storage systems will be in place when operation begins. Personnel are trained on safety concerns and general operation procedures as well as emergency procedures. 



Several process controls are in use for the blowing agent system, including vents, relief valves, check valves, manual shutoffs, automatic shutoffs, interlocks, alarms, rupture disks, dikes and excess flow devices.  Similarly, several mitigation systems inside the facility such as double containment hoses, ventilation, and fire walls are in use.



Emergency Response Plan



The Gresham Facility has its own Emergency Response Plan that includes specific actions to be taken in response to accidental releases, procedures for informing the public and local agencies, and information on emergency health care.

  

Five-Year Accident History



The Gresham Facility has had no blowing agent releases in the past five years.
